library(tidyverse)
library(paletteer)
theme_set(hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum_rc())

The palettes are divided into 2 groups; discrete and continuous. For discrete palette you have the choice between the fixed width palettes and dynamic palettes.

This package includes 2759 palettes from 75 different packages and information about these can be found in the following data.frames: palettes_c_names, palettes_d_names and palettes_dynamic_names. Additionally this github repo showcases all the palettes included in the package and more.

palettes_c_names
# A tibble: 319 × 3
   package  palette               type      
   <chr>    <chr>                 <chr>     
 1 ggthemes Blue-Green Sequential sequential
 2 ggthemes Blue Light            sequential
 3 ggthemes Orange Light          sequential
 4 ggthemes Blue                  sequential

 6 ggthemes Green                 sequential
 7 ggthemes Red                   sequential
 8 ggthemes Purple                sequential
 9 ggthemes Brown                 sequential

# ℹ 309 more rows

# A tibble: 2,415 × 5

# ℹ 2,405 more rows

1 Examples

All the palettes can be accessed from the 3 functions paletteer_c(), paletteer_d() and paletteer_dynamic() using the by using the syntax packagename::palettename.

paletteer_d(`"awtools::a_palette"`)
<colors>
#2A363BFF #019875FF #99B898FF #FECEA8FF #FF847CFF #E84A5FFF #C0392BFF #96281BFF 
paletteer_dynamic(`"cartography::blue.pal"`, n = 4)
<colors>
#9AD3EBFF #6AACCCFF #2F7CA6FF #125A84FF

2 ggplot2 scales

iris %>% 
  ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 2.5) +
  scale_color_paletteer_d(`"ButterflyColors::astraptes_fulgerator"`)

```{r}
#| label: setup
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(paletteer)
theme_set(hrbrthemes::theme_ipsum_rc())
```

The palettes are divided into 2 groups; discrete and continuous. For discrete palette you have the choice between the fixed width palettes and dynamic palettes.

This package includes 2759 palettes from 75 different packages and information about these can be found in the following data.frames: `palettes_c_names`, `palettes_d_names` and `palettes_dynamic_names`. Additionally this [github repo](https://github.com/EmilHvitfeldt/r-color-palettes) showcases all the palettes included in the package and more.

```{r}
palettes_c_names
```

```{r}
palettes_d_names
```

## Examples

All the palettes can be accessed from the 3 functions `paletteer_c()`, `paletteer_d()` and `paletteer_dynamic()` using the by using the syntax packagename::palettename.

```{r}
paletteer_d(`"awtools::a_palette"`)
```

```{r}
paletteer_dynamic(`"cartography::blue.pal"`, n = 4)
```

## ggplot2 scales

```{r}
iris %>% 
  ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +
  geom_point(size = 2.5) +
  scale_color_paletteer_d(`"ButterflyColors::astraptes_fulgerator"`)
```
